meanings.definition: A person who imitates or copies the behavior or actions of another.
meanings.sent1: The young boy was known as the emulators in the class, always copying what his friends did.
meanings.sent2: The talented actor was praised for his ability to portray different characters, making him a skilled emulators.
meanings.sent3: At the party, Sarah jokingly called herself the emulators of the dance moves, trying to mimic the professional dancers.
meanings.sent4: In the world of fashion, she was considered the emulators, replicating the styles of famous designers with precision.
meanings.sent5: The emulators in the play perfectly mirrored the actions of the lead actor, showcasing their dedication to the performance.

meanings.definition: Software or hardware that enables one computer system to behave like another.
meanings.sent1: Tech enthusiasts often use emulators to run old video games on modern computers.
meanings.sent2: The company developed an emulator to test the compatibility of their software across different platforms.
meanings.sent3: During the workshop, the presenter humorously referred to the emulator as a 'computer chameleon.'
meanings.sent4: The emulator acted as a digital translator, allowing the program to communicate with the unfamiliar system.
meanings.sent5: Using the emulator, researchers recreated the historic computer system to study its impact on early computing.
